author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: ‘Bats’ man Lies heads to Midcoast
text:
‘Bats’ man Lies heads to Midcoast Oct 20, 2015 A handpainted bat box by Brian Lies is being auctioned off at the Maine Coastal Islands National Wildlife Refuge Visitor Center. 
Rockland — Author/illustrator Brian Lies, with his New York Times best-selling bat series books, is coming to town on Halloween to celebrate National Bat Week. 
Lies will be at the Maine Coastal Islands National Wildlife Refuge Visitor Center, 9 Water St., Saturday, Oct. 31, from 10 a.m. to noon as part of a free children’s program to raise awareness about bats. He will read a book from his acclaimed bat book series, including “Bats at the Beach” and “Bats at the Library”; and do a second reading after a bat craft activity. Lies’ bat books will be available for purchase and autographs, with proceeds going to support educational programming at the refuge. 
Lies also is donating a one-of-a-kind bat box, handpainted with an original illustration of one of his bats, that will go to the highest bidder in a silent auction. Bids may be submitted by email to fomsi@maineseabirds.org or in person at the Nature Shop at the Visitor Center. Highest bidder at 3 p.m. on Halloween will get the box. For more information, call 594-0600, ext. 5, or visit maineseabirds.org .
